representativeParagraphs.text:
Our business depends on a complex global supply chain that relies on
third-party manufacturing partners and logistics providers. Disruptions
from geopolitical events, labor constraints, or transportation delays can
reduce product availability, increase costs, and impact our ability to
meet demand. These risk factors can pressure margins and delay product
launches across multiple regions.

Demand for our devices and services can shift quickly due to competitive
offerings, pricing pressure, or changes in customer preferences. If we do
not anticipate these changes, inventory levels may rise and promotional
activity could increase. Risk factors also include regulatory scrutiny and
changes in privacy expectations that may require product or platform
adjustments.

We rely on third-party components and software to deliver key features,
and security vulnerabilities in those components could harm our products
and services. Cybersecurity incidents, including data breaches or service
outages, could result in reputational harm, litigation, and significant
remediation costs. These risk factors may also affect the trust of
customers and partners.
